GOD.content: [another secret] Christian mysterium tremendum, fear and trembling before sacrificial gift, person being paralyzed, in its singularity, by the gaze of God
GOD.linkedContent: [another secret] Christian mysterium tremendum, fear and trembling before sacrificial gift, person being paralyzed, in its singularity, by the gaze of God

GT.content: subject and object are arrested effects of the gift, arrests of the gift; subject as such never gives or receives a gift
GT.linkedContent: subject and object are arrested effects of the gift, arrests of the gift; subject as such never gives or receives a gift

H.content: delay and haste, halting and hastening, rhythm of Oedipus’ journey; p. 127 infinite speed contracted into an absolute halt or haste, precipitation because delay, instant of an instant that is canceled out > thus always late & precipitous re: hospitality
H.linkedContent: delay and haste, halting and hastening, rhythm of Oedipus’ journey; p. 127 infinite speed contracted into an absolute halt or haste, precipitation because delay, instant of an instant that is canceled out > thus always late & precipitous re: hospitality

H.content: mourning is not allowed without a fixed (arrêté) place, monument, determinable topos, stopping point (arrêt) > promised w/out taking place, only possible mourning is an impossible one
H.linkedContent: mourning is not allowed without a fixed (arrêté) place, monument, determinable topos, stopping point (arrêt) > promised w/out taking place, only possible mourning is an impossible one

LOBL.content: it is impossible for living speech to speak on living [sur vivre?], unless it’s impossible only w/ living speech: aporia even more paralyzing
LOBL.linkedContent: it is impossible for living speech to speak on living [sur vivre?], unless it’s impossible only w/ living speech: aporia even more paralyzing

LOBL.content: Blanchot: survivre, not living maintaining oneself, lifeless, in a state of pure supplement, movement of supplementing life, but stopping (arrêter) the dying, a stopping that doesn’t stop > speak on the arrête (ridge, cutting edge, backbone, fish bone, arris)
LOBL.linkedContent: Blanchot: survivre, not living maintaining oneself, lifeless, in a state of pure supplement, movement of supplementing life, but stopping (arrêter) the dying, a stopping that doesn’t stop > speak on the arrête (ridge, cutting edge, backbone, fish bone, arris)

LOBL.content: via Hartman, is arrêt de mort “death sentence” or “suspension of death”?
LOBL.linkedContent: via Hartman, is arrêt de mort “death sentence” or “suspension of death”?

LOBL.content: life being drawn through by sharp dividing line, edge where it is impossible to settle: arrête, angle of instability impossible to settle (s’arrêter)
LOBL.linkedContent: life being drawn through by sharp dividing line, edge where it is impossible to settle: arrête, angle of instability impossible to settle (s’arrêter)

LOBL.content: arrêt de mort: decision on what can’t be decided—it also arrests death by suspending it: gives “living on”
LOBL.linkedContent: arrêt de mort: decision on what can’t be decided—it also arrests death by suspending it: gives “living on”

LOBL.content: crisis is the urgency, instant, of impossible decision (krinein, judgment is the impossible to reach), the suspensive arrêt suspends the decisive arrêt and vice versa > arrhythmic pulsation, imparts movement in stopping, never sure, unfortunately, fortunately
LOBL.linkedContent: crisis is the urgency, instant, of impossible decision (krinein, judgment is the impossible to reach), the suspensive arrêt suspends the decisive arrêt and vice versa > arrhythmic pulsation, imparts movement in stopping, never sure, unfortunately, fortunately

LOBL.content: like death, arrêt remains undecidable, one arrêt marks delay, the other haste [2 syntaxes]
LOBL.linkedContent: like death, arrêt remains undecidable, one arrêt marks delay, the other haste [2 syntaxes]

LOBL.content: suspensive arrêt already [déjà] undecided because it suspends, decisive arrêt undecided because what it decides, death, la Chose, the neuter, is undecidability itself
LOBL.linkedContent: suspensive arrêt already [déjà] undecided because it suspends, decisive arrêt undecided because what it decides, death, la Chose, the neuter, is undecidability itself

LOBL.content: the suspensive arrêt arrests the decisive arrêt and vice versa, the arrêt de mort arrests the arrêt de mort, arrhythmic pulsation of title [Blanchot’s] before it scatters like sand, in stopping (s’arrêtant) (as arrêt), it gives movement, sets in motion [prime mover]
LOBL.linkedContent: the suspensive arrêt arrests the decisive arrêt and vice versa, the arrêt de mort arrests the arrêt de mort, arrhythmic pulsation of title [Blanchot’s] before it scatters like sand, in stopping (s’arrêtant) (as arrêt), it gives movement, sets in motion [prime mover]

LOBL.content: antagony from arrêt to arrêt, an Aufhebung that never lets up, arrêt arresting arrêt, both senses, both ways
LOBL.linkedContent: antagony from arrêt to arrêt, an Aufhebung that never lets up, arrêt arresting arrêt, both senses, both ways

LOBL.content: arrêt de mort as verdict
LOBL.linkedContent: arrêt de mort as verdict

LOBL.content: arrêt arrests itself, stands, stays unstable, remains on arête of itself, it a-rests (for) itself, no consciousness, perception, no watchfulness can gather this remnance, no “I”, hence ghosts, fantasies, epochal pause
LOBL.linkedContent: arrêt arrests itself, stands, stays unstable, remains on arête of itself, it a-rests (for) itself, no consciousness, perception, no watchfulness can gather this remnance, no “I”, hence ghosts, fantasies, epochal pause

LOBL.content: l’arrêt de mort, “ingenious” decision, one of those that are made (s’arrêtent) only in a language, escape signature by any “I”, untranslatable, decision is unreadable > unreadability does not arrest reading in face of opaque surface, it starts reading, writing, translating again
LOBL.linkedContent: l’arrêt de mort, “ingenious” decision, one of those that are made (s’arrêtent) only in a language, escape signature by any “I”, untranslatable, decision is unreadable > unreadability does not arrest reading in face of opaque surface, it starts reading, writing, translating again

LOBL.content: unreadable not opposite of readable but the ridge (arête) that sets in motion
LOBL.linkedContent: unreadable not opposite of readable but the ridge (arête) that sets in motion

LOBL.content: infinite violence [of what’s strictly called] “double bind,” double invagination, double obligation, double demand > sans arrêt and arrêt de mort, no reconciliation
LOBL.linkedContent: infinite violence [of what’s strictly called] “double bind,” double invagination, double obligation, double demand > sans arrêt and arrêt de mort, no reconciliation

LOBL.content: death sentence, instant as elusive as last grain of sand in hourglass, death as result of dissemination of rhythm of life w/ no coup d’arrêt, unbordered/unbounded arrhythmy on beach that’s continuation of a sea: her pulse “scattered like sand”
LOBL.linkedContent: death sentence, instant as elusive as last grain of sand in hourglass, death as result of dissemination of rhythm of life w/ no coup d’arrêt, unbordered/unbounded arrhythmy on beach that’s continuation of a sea: her pulse “scattered like sand”

LOBL.content: je m’arrête > “same interdiction encrypts the resurrection at the moment when he sees the terrible Chose”
LOBL.linkedContent: je m’arrête > “same interdiction encrypts the resurrection at the moment when he sees the terrible Chose”

LOBL.content: more-than-life (sur-vie) marks a reprieve, excess triumphs over life, worth more than eternity of life but presents itself before the arrêt de mort
LOBL.linkedContent: more-than-life (sur-vie) marks a reprieve, excess triumphs over life, worth more than eternity of life but presents itself before the arrêt de mort

LOBL.content: commitment [wedding proposal] in irresponsibility of speech [Blanchot’s character proposes in Slavic not French], arrêt of commitment, commitment thus arrêté, both in one’s language & the other’s—the hymen > mother tongue does away w/ commitment & seals it
LOBL.linkedContent: commitment [wedding proposal] in irresponsibility of speech [Blanchot’s character proposes in Slavic not French], arrêt of commitment, commitment thus arrêté, both in one’s language & the other’s—the hymen > mother tongue does away w/ commitment & seals it

LOBL.content: [reference to la double séance] hymen s’arrête, comes about and is immediately forbidden, double-bind structure of event, its “madness”, every hymen intervenes like a crime, event, coup, its dissemination dissolves or absolves it in crowd by multiplying it incalculably
LOBL.linkedContent: [reference to la double séance] hymen s’arrête, comes about and is immediately forbidden, double-bind structure of event, its “madness”, every hymen intervenes like a crime, event, coup, its dissemination dissolves or absolves it in crowd by multiplying it incalculably

LOBL.content: embalm [fetish?], set about the arrêt de mort in its double triumph: effigy, chambers of this desire in a sort of “funeral home” > [Blanchot’s narrator] loves them dead, he loves (by) seeing them dead
LOBL.linkedContent: embalm [fetish?], set about the arrêt de mort in its double triumph: effigy, chambers of this desire in a sort of “funeral home” > [Blanchot’s narrator] loves them dead, he loves (by) seeing them dead

LOBL.content: there’s an arrêt btwn 2 deaths [in L’arrêt de mort], thus hypertopia [see p. 140]
LOBL.linkedContent: there’s an arrêt btwn 2 deaths [in L’arrêt de mort], thus hypertopia [see p. 140]

LOBL.content: interruption, connectionless connection of arrêt > passes through insides w/out insides of ego of récitant
LOBL.linkedContent: interruption, connectionless connection of arrêt > passes through insides w/out insides of ego of récitant

LOBL.content: hymen, double bind, double affirmation, yes, yes, come, come [re: Blanchot’s 2 ghostly fiancées in L’arrêt de mort] signifies, desires, arrête life death, the life the death of the other, the other lives and dies > “for there is an other of the other and it is not the same” [see POO p. 11 “other of the other” is the very undeniable of ethics]
LOBL.linkedContent: hymen, double bind, double affirmation, yes, yes, come, come [re: Blanchot’s 2 ghostly fiancées in L’arrêt de mort] signifies, desires, arrête life death, the life the death of the other, the other lives and dies > “for there is an other of the other and it is not the same” [see POO p. 11 “other of the other” is the very undeniable of ethics]

LOBL.content: arrêt w/out Aufhebung
LOBL.linkedContent: arrêt w/out Aufhebung

LOBL.content: arrêt de mort brings about the arrêt of the law
LOBL.linkedContent: arrêt de mort brings about the arrêt of the law

POO.content: impossible to respond, impossible not to respond, double bind, 2 hands nailed down [no choice]
POO.linkedContent: impossible to respond, impossible not to respond, double bind, 2 hands nailed down [no choice]

POO.content: brought to a halt [arrêt?] when faced w/ contradictory orders
POO.linkedContent: brought to a halt [arrêt?] when faced w/ contradictory orders

POOF.content: via Schmitt, stasis implies state of rest, arrest (status) & also revolt [in this sense stasis could name auto-immunity], stásis as a category of political nosography, misfortune, fatal disorder, bad luck
POOF.linkedContent: via Schmitt, stasis implies state of rest, arrest (status) & also revolt [in this sense stasis could name auto-immunity], stásis as a category of political nosography, misfortune, fatal disorder, bad luck

A.content: aporia, experience of what’s fascinating in the nonpassage: “not knowing where to go,” paralyzed by separation
A.linkedContent: aporia, experience of what’s fascinating in the nonpassage: “not knowing where to go,” paralyzed by separation

PAS.content: double pas never arresting itself in dialectical negativity of its proceeding nor in the march of a method, the trope of standing-upright
PAS.linkedContent: double pas never arresting itself in dialectical negativity of its proceeding nor in the march of a method, the trope of standing-upright

PAS.content: Blanchot: she comes closer every pas to the instant when she must stop herself
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: she comes closer every pas to the instant when she must stop herself

PAS.content: ce désir de la paralysie qui n’arrête jamais
PAS.linkedContent: ce désir de la paralysie qui n’arrête jamais

PAS.content: Blanchot: lucidity could do nothing but render my paralysis infinite
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: lucidity could do nothing but render my paralysis infinite

PAS.content: paralysis that does not prohibit anything, that makes movement [see ROP p. 21] > le faux mouvement qui procède selon le faut-pas du désir et franchit la limite
PAS.linkedContent: paralysis that does not prohibit anything, that makes movement [see ROP p. 21] > le faux mouvement qui procède selon le faut-pas du désir et franchit la limite

PAS.content: isn’t the thought of la paralyse a thought of the obscene Medusa? good for laughter too
PAS.linkedContent: isn’t the thought of la paralyse a thought of the obscene Medusa? good for laughter too

F.content: je m’arrête ici, déjà (tombe en arrêt [vault to a stop]), setting on the “edge of the crypt” a voiceless word, a blank stone of a scruple [see p. xlviii], to engage others to it, of a crypt
F.linkedContent: je m’arrête ici, déjà (tombe en arrêt [vault to a stop]), setting on the “edge of the crypt” a voiceless word, a blank stone of a scruple [see p. xlviii], to engage others to it, of a crypt

F.content: cryptophore, à manger le morceau (le mors) sans pouvoir le digérer, must constantly betray cipher that seals and conceals it > Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, truly cryptic story
F.linkedContent: cryptophore, à manger le morceau (le mors) sans pouvoir le digérer, must constantly betray cipher that seals and conceals it > Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, truly cryptic story

F.content: paelontologist médusé devant l’arête d’un mot-chose, like a tomb burning in the grass, double-edged stare of a 2-faced Medusa (le double tranchant d’un biface)
F.linkedContent: paelontologist médusé devant l’arête d’un mot-chose, like a tomb burning in the grass, double-edged stare of a 2-faced Medusa (le double tranchant d’un biface)

DS.content: a system that is closed-in on itself would be checked by a safety-catch (un cran d’arrêt)——wrong to interpret Mallarmé’s Mimique as oriented toward its abysses, its false bottoms, as if they were pretextual referents > a writing that refers back only to itself is some other writing
DS.linkedContent: a system that is closed-in on itself would be checked by a safety-catch (un cran d’arrêt)——wrong to interpret Mallarmé’s Mimique as oriented toward its abysses, its false bottoms, as if they were pretextual referents > a writing that refers back only to itself is some other writing

DS.content: syntax of hymen’s fold makes it impossible to arrest its play of indecision [i.e. to stop it on “mental,” or “imaginary”]
DS.linkedContent: syntax of hymen’s fold makes it impossible to arrest its play of indecision [i.e. to stop it on “mental,” or “imaginary”]

OS.content: for Aristotle, the point gives to length its continuity and limit, an end and a beginning (arkhē kai teleutē); but ‘now’ is not to time what point is to line, because successive arrests does not give time (ne donne pas le temps); instead, now is neither time’s origin, end or limit (to the extent that it belongs to time) > instead, must conceive of gramme [French] not as line (by way of its parts or points) but as a line in act, by way of its extremities (ta eskhata)
OS.linkedContent: for Aristotle, the point gives to length its continuity and limit, an end and a beginning (arkhē kai teleutē); but ‘now’ is not to time what point is to line, because successive arrests does not give time (ne donne pas le temps); instead, now is neither time’s origin, end or limit (to the extent that it belongs to time) > instead, must conceive of gramme [French] not as line (by way of its parts or points) but as a line in act, by way of its extremities (ta eskhata)

P.content: re: sublime, arrest of outpouring (épanchement) at floodgate (vanne), pressed on limit, pleasure gushes after arrest, inhibition, suspension (Hemmung), an arresting that makes flow > for a blink of an eye passage is closed, stricture absolute, then barrage, l’inondation
P.linkedContent: re: sublime, arrest of outpouring (épanchement) at floodgate (vanne), pressed on limit, pleasure gushes after arrest, inhibition, suspension (Hemmung), an arresting that makes flow > for a blink of an eye passage is closed, stricture absolute, then barrage, l’inondation

ROP.content: paralysis gives movement w/ regard to its other [this is in reference to impossibility of psychoanalysis’ auto-interpretation] (in PAS, paralysis distinguished from logic of analysis)
ROP.linkedContent: paralysis gives movement w/ regard to its other [this is in reference to impossibility of psychoanalysis’ auto-interpretation] (in PAS, paralysis distinguished from logic of analysis)

ROP.content: instead of “failure” of archaeological/anagogical principle [of analysis], this principle is destined to limit of its arrest, finitude of its suspense > there’s chance in falling-due, given of fall
ROP.linkedContent: instead of “failure” of archaeological/anagogical principle [of analysis], this principle is destined to limit of its arrest, finitude of its suspense > there’s chance in falling-due, given of fall

OTO.content: [Nietzsche’s] life can only be verified after or during arrêt de mort > when the bearer of the name, whom, in our prejudice, we call living, will have died
OTO.linkedContent: [Nietzsche’s] life can only be verified after or during arrêt de mort > when the bearer of the name, whom, in our prejudice, we call living, will have died

O.content: “transcendental signified” arrests writing [in structure of double mark this arrest can no longer occur, writing as possibility of living on, arrêt de mort]
O.linkedContent: “transcendental signified” arrests writing [in structure of double mark this arrest can no longer occur, writing as possibility of living on, arrêt de mort]

O.content: dissemination blows up (saute) security of point, arrested in name of the law: it is at the risk, to risk this blowup (to make this jump, faire sauter) that dissemination broaches/has been broached
O.linkedContent: dissemination blows up (saute) security of point, arrested in name of the law: it is at the risk, to risk this blowup (to make this jump, faire sauter) that dissemination broaches/has been broached

DPi.content: DP: arrêtée par un arrêt de justice > an end decreed by the Other, a verdict > this is not the archetype of every decision [?], though it reminds us: sovereign decision always the Other’s
DPi.linkedContent: DP: arrêtée par un arrêt de justice > an end decreed by the Other, a verdict > this is not the archetype of every decision [?], though it reminds us: sovereign decision always the Other’s

REST.content: to stop one’s feet at the starting line is a place in language [re: Derrida’s starting point, a place where things no longer slide? from which he’ll set off quickly]
REST.linkedContent: to stop one’s feet at the starting line is a place in language [re: Derrida’s starting point, a place where things no longer slide? from which he’ll set off quickly]

REST.content: everything on trial (tout chose en procès), publicized, the proximate cause is a trap: a double that doesn’t make a pair, makes a trap, can’t put one’s feet in them, Christic shade of bait [sole? proper subject? Van Gogh’s surrender?], Christ’s flesh is bait for the Devil (Muscipula Diaboli); in PAS, another type of trap > la paralyse
REST.linkedContent: everything on trial (tout chose en procès), publicized, the proximate cause is a trap: a double that doesn’t make a pair, makes a trap, can’t put one’s feet in them, Christic shade of bait [sole? proper subject? Van Gogh’s surrender?], Christ’s flesh is bait for the Devil (Muscipula Diaboli); in PAS, another type of trap > la paralyse

REST.content: betting on the pair, plus/pas de pari, trap always works in interlace (la piège marche toujours dans l’entrelacs): soit qu’il fasse marcher, laisse marcher ou qu’il paralyse [p. 373 only the pair can go]
REST.linkedContent: betting on the pair, plus/pas de pari, trap always works in interlace (la piège marche toujours dans l’entrelacs): soit qu’il fasse marcher, laisse marcher ou qu’il paralyse [p. 373 only the pair can go]

DST.content: un autre indécidable, the gap/hiatus in an undecidable derived from dialectical calculation/contraction, arrhythmic caesura as respiration of rhythm (this necessity awaits us) [pas, heartbeat] [Derrida here wonders if double bind is too dialectical, thus the other undecidable]
DST.linkedContent: un autre indécidable, the gap/hiatus in an undecidable derived from dialectical calculation/contraction, arrhythmic caesura as respiration of rhythm (this necessity awaits us) [pas, heartbeat] [Derrida here wonders if double bind is too dialectical, thus the other undecidable]

DST.content: no rhythm w/out caesura > antirhythmic [Hölderlin], arrhythmic
DST.linkedContent: no rhythm w/out caesura > antirhythmic [Hölderlin], arrhythmic

DST.content: interrupts alternation, constraint of opposition, even double bind [cf. p. 225]
DST.linkedContent: interrupts alternation, constraint of opposition, even double bind [cf. p. 225]

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: caesura is empty moment, intrusion of prophetic word (Tiresias)
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: caesura is empty moment, intrusion of prophetic word (Tiresias)

DST.content: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech
DST.linkedContent: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech

PIO.content: specularization paralyzes “Fable” (seems to freeze text)—undecidability of whether fabulous discourse makes it out of itself or is the very misfortune (malheurs) of the [possibility of the] mirror, infelicity of constative/performative (way they parasite each other)
PIO.linkedContent: specularization paralyzes “Fable” (seems to freeze text)—undecidability of whether fabulous discourse makes it out of itself or is the very misfortune (malheurs) of the [possibility of the] mirror, infelicity of constative/performative (way they parasite each other)

RM.content: [cf. Pas] the dérive or dérapage (skidding) as un certain jeu de l’ancre in surrounding waters (parages): Derrida can only stop engines (machines) of this floating vehicle [my discourse on metaphor], which would still abandon it to its unforeseeable dérive [more metaphorico]
RM.linkedContent: [cf. Pas] the dérive or dérapage (skidding) as un certain jeu de l’ancre in surrounding waters (parages): Derrida can only stop engines (machines) of this floating vehicle [my discourse on metaphor], which would still abandon it to its unforeseeable dérive [more metaphorico]

PF.content: a trace w/out alibi resists thinking, paralyzes, also only chance to not give in to paralysis
PF.linkedContent: a trace w/out alibi resists thinking, paralyzes, also only chance to not give in to paralysis

PF.content: paralysis arrests: negative symptom of aporia > whereas aporia, possibility of impossible, of “play,” very condition of pas, experience of frayage, marche, via rupta [elsewhere Derrida deconstructs becoming route?], decision, event, coming of other: writing & desire
PF.linkedContent: paralysis arrests: negative symptom of aporia > whereas aporia, possibility of impossible, of “play,” very condition of pas, experience of frayage, marche, via rupta [elsewhere Derrida deconstructs becoming route?], decision, event, coming of other: writing & desire

TR.content: not only accusation & judgment in confession, there’s the executioner (carrying out of the sentence): sentence endured in pleasure of writing, ambiguous enjoyment at heart of terrible, severe jubilation of inscription: one steps up to cashier right away to collect interest on a capital that will assume value only “sooner or later,” after my death, in my absence
TR.linkedContent: not only accusation & judgment in confession, there’s the executioner (carrying out of the sentence): sentence endured in pleasure of writing, ambiguous enjoyment at heart of terrible, severe jubilation of inscription: one steps up to cashier right away to collect interest on a capital that will assume value only “sooner or later,” after my death, in my absence

HST.content: Levinas: future (avenir) as a resurrection of the present; “next instant” is an annulment of commitment to existence made in the instant; the “I’s” death in the empty interval: condition of new birth
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: future (avenir) as a resurrection of the present; “next instant” is an annulment of commitment to existence made in the instant; the “I’s” death in the empty interval: condition of new birth

HST.content: at moment where everything is lost, everything is possible
HST.linkedContent: at moment where everything is lost, everything is possible

HST.content: infinite compassion: the decision of not being able to stop (as life itself never stops [ne se désarme]) > forgiveness, w/out saying anything
HST.linkedContent: infinite compassion: the decision of not being able to stop (as life itself never stops [ne se désarme]) > forgiveness, w/out saying anything

+R.content: survival movement, arrêt de mort, final trance, sursaut cambré tenu au mors: says “I” (am dead) or hoc est corpus meum > dominant fish, one that bites best, takes from sea a body of scaly writing, homogenous w/ signatory’s initials
+R.linkedContent: survival movement, arrêt de mort, final trance, sursaut cambré tenu au mors: says “I” (am dead) or hoc est corpus meum > dominant fish, one that bites best, takes from sea a body of scaly writing, homogenous w/ signatory’s initials

+R.content: death dance in fish’s tail (queue) > rhythmos: cadence of writing, undulation of waves
+R.linkedContent: death dance in fish’s tail (queue) > rhythmos: cadence of writing, undulation of waves

LI.content: every police (red light) is not repressive: law not necessarily tied to negativity, prohibition, repression
LI.linkedContent: every police (red light) is not repressive: law not necessarily tied to negativity, prohibition, repression

LI.content: differance as nonidentity w/ oneself in process of determination > differance is itself nothing outside of determination, never comes to a full stop (not negativity, nothingness)
LI.linkedContent: differance as nonidentity w/ oneself in process of determination > differance is itself nothing outside of determination, never comes to a full stop (not negativity, nothingness)

TN.content: Nancy stopped short one day (était un jour tombé en arrêt) before Freud’s “psyche is extended, knows nothing about it” > this is a beginning by freezing (par s’immobiliser)
TN.linkedContent: Nancy stopped short one day (était un jour tombé en arrêt) before Freud’s “psyche is extended, knows nothing about it” > this is a beginning by freezing (par s’immobiliser)

TN.content: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth

TN.content: self-relation, “s’efforcer” > institutes/born to itself as exertion moment when limit insists, resists > efforcement as effort/limit, a finite force s’arrête, and se replie toward itself depuis sa fin
TN.linkedContent: self-relation, “s’efforcer” > institutes/born to itself as exertion moment when limit insists, resists > efforcement as effort/limit, a finite force s’arrête, and se replie toward itself depuis sa fin

TN.content: pause for a moment (pour s’arrêter un instant)
TN.linkedContent: pause for a moment (pour s’arrêter un instant)

E.content: Kant: sublime occurs due to a momentary checking (Hemmung, an arrest), and its pleasure (admiration or respect) is a negative pleasure
E.linkedContent: Kant: sublime occurs due to a momentary checking (Hemmung, an arrest), and its pleasure (admiration or respect) is a negative pleasure

EW.content: unconditional affirmation that motivates deconstruction can always upset an instituted rhythm of every pause (subject is a pause, stabilizing arrest, the thesis we will always need [?])
EW.linkedContent: unconditional affirmation that motivates deconstruction can always upset an instituted rhythm of every pause (subject is a pause, stabilizing arrest, the thesis we will always need [?])

AD.content: neither welcome nor hospitality w/out radical alterity: presupposes separation, social bond, unbinding, gives respiration: le chez-soi (at-home-with-oneself) would no longer be natural, rooted, but a response to a wandering (errance), phénomène de l'errance qu'il arrête
AD.linkedContent: neither welcome nor hospitality w/out radical alterity: presupposes separation, social bond, unbinding, gives respiration: le chez-soi (at-home-with-oneself) would no longer be natural, rooted, but a response to a wandering (errance), phénomène de l'errance qu'il arrête

AD.content: the instantaneous meantime of the decision (l’entretemps instantané de la décision), contretemps, hiatus, or non-response, discontinues speech and is gift of speech
AD.linkedContent: the instantaneous meantime of the decision (l’entretemps instantané de la décision), contretemps, hiatus, or non-response, discontinues speech and is gift of speech

OG.content: acc. Hegel, writing (an Umweg) betrays life/breath > finitude/paralysis, sterilizes spirit, principle of difference/death in becoming of being (is to speech, what China is to Europe)
OG.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, writing (an Umweg) betrays life/breath > finitude/paralysis, sterilizes spirit, principle of difference/death in becoming of being (is to speech, what China is to Europe)

OG.content: passivity of speech can’t be distinguished from relation btwn unconsciousness of language and spacing (pause, blank, punctuation, interval) that constitutes origin of signification in general
OG.linkedContent: passivity of speech can’t be distinguished from relation btwn unconsciousness of language and spacing (pause, blank, punctuation, interval) that constitutes origin of signification in general

OG.content: becoming-space of time & becoming-time of space mark dead time w/in presence of living present > dead time is at work, les blancs take on importance > limit of phenomenology
OG.linkedContent: becoming-space of time & becoming-time of space mark dead time w/in presence of living present > dead time is at work, les blancs take on importance > limit of phenomenology

ATAP.content: death, another apocalypse—whoever speaks apocalyptically: truth of truth, truth as end, Last Judgment, seduces w/ unbearable pure differential vibration (the 1st)
ATAP.linkedContent: death, another apocalypse—whoever speaks apocalyptically: truth of truth, truth as end, Last Judgment, seduces w/ unbearable pure differential vibration (the 1st)

ATAP.content: this death sentence, cet arrêt de mort, can only judge us, those who don’t know this secret are already dead, so… let’s make a sect, sex, gender, race (Geschlecht) by ourselves [Babel scene] > we are the only ones in the world
ATAP.linkedContent: this death sentence, cet arrêt de mort, can only judge us, those who don’t know this secret are already dead, so… let’s make a sect, sex, gender, race (Geschlecht) by ourselves [Babel scene] > we are the only ones in the world

SPEC.content: Freud repeats his arrest, pas de marche: speculative possibility of tout autre (than PP), inscribed in advance w/in it, “l’ouvre d’une scription de l’autre à meme (overlaps) le principe”
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud repeats his arrest, pas de marche: speculative possibility of tout autre (than PP), inscribed in advance w/in it, “l’ouvre d’une scription de l’autre à meme (overlaps) le principe”

SPEC.content: the thesis would be l’arrêt de mort of differance, arresting death in 2 senses [vis-à-vis syntax]: condemns to death & interruption suspending death
SPEC.linkedContent: the thesis would be l’arrêt de mort of differance, arresting death in 2 senses [vis-à-vis syntax]: condemns to death & interruption suspending death

SPEC.content: same step (pas) [Freud’s step beyond PP] gives & suspends movement, es gibt, exemplary movement of paralysis [Derrida repeating too, cf. FSW, PAS] [démarche]
SPEC.linkedContent: same step (pas) [Freud’s step beyond PP] gives & suspends movement, es gibt, exemplary movement of paralysis [Derrida repeating too, cf. FSW, PAS] [démarche]

SPEC.content: “la paralyse: le pas au-delà du PP sera resté interdit”
SPEC.linkedContent: “la paralyse: le pas au-delà du PP sera resté interdit”
